security: Revealing that the CIA has a source within the Cuban Sugar Stabilization Board (“the chief of the Cuban Sugar Stabilization Board who has the job of selling Cuba's sugar”) who is disillusioned with Castro and providing information could compromise the source and hinder future intelligence gathering efforts. Detailing CASTRO as ruthless and using inside information ("his mind automatically photostating details which he can and will use in the future") in economic and agrarian reforms reveals the CIA’s collection methods and CASTRO’s way of thinking.
summary: A CIA field information report details the deteriorating financial status of the Cuban economy in August 1959, based on information from a source within the Cuban Sugar Stabilization Board, highlighting the impact of Castro's policies and agrarian reforms.
summary_one_paragraph: This confidential field information report, dated August 21, 1959, sourced from a Cuban government official (Alberto FERNANDEZ Rechavarria) within the Sugar Stabilization Board, reveals the declining state of the Cuban economy under Fidel Castro's regime. The report outlines that, contrary to official statements, Cuba's financial status is rapidly deteriorating due to Castro's agrarian reform policies and substantial government subsidies. It notes warnings given to Castro about the treasury's depletion and the increasing unemployment among farm workers, further speculating on the potential for Castro to seek loans from either the U.S. or the Soviet Union, with the latter possibly ending friendly relations with the U.S.
title: Cuban Economic Crisis
sender: Nelson L. Raynock/psa 1AE, Woodrow C. Olien
